## Z scores
```{r}
x_vec = rnorm(25, mean = 5, sd = 3)
(x_vec - mean(x_vec)) / sd(x_vec)

#as a function
z_scores = function(x) {
  z = (x - mean(x)) / sd(x)
  return(z)
}

#call function
z_scores(x = x_vec)

#another example
y_vec = rnorm(40, mean = 12, sd = .3)
z_scores(y_vec)
```


How great is this?
Only kinda great --> gives error is no numerical input

```{r}
z_scores = function(x){
  if (!is.numeric(x)) {
    stop("x needs to be numeric")
  }
  if (length(x) < 3 ) {
    stop("x should have at least 3 numbers")
  }
  
  z = (x - mean(x)) / sd(x)
  return(z)
}
```

```{r, error = TRUE}
z_scores(3)
z_scores(c("My", "name", "is"))
z_scores(mtcars)
z_scores(y_vec)
```
